channel.title: Quick PI question
channel.description:
how do i do something along the lines of:
[code] if (npcIsHere()) doThis() else if (npcIsThere()) doThat() [/code]

item.title: Quick PI question
item.dc:creator: @Jacob5 Jacob_
item.description:
@Jacob5 wrote:

Instead of

if (npcX == xCoord && npcY == yCoord) {
    // do something
}

could you do,

if (npcId == npcId) { // do something.. }

Read full topic

item.description:

[code=java]
if (x == id) {
// do this
}

// to

if (npcId == id) {
// do that
}[/code][/quote]

I may just end up doing 2 npc’s, because that^ makes no sense.

item.title: Quick PI question
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

[5/9/12 9:02 PM]: java.lang.NullPointerException
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.npcs.NPCHandler.saniboch2(NPCHandler.java:1145) <-- if statement
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.players.ActionHandler.secondClickNpc(ActionHandler.java:1048)
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.players.packets.ClickNPC.processPacket(ClickNPC.java:185)
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.players.PacketHandler.processPacket(PacketHandler.java:138)
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.players.Client.processQueuedPackets(Client.java:922)
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.model.players.PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:136)
[5/9/12 9:02 PM]:       at server.Server.main(Server.java:152)

Um, could you possibly set the condition to be an npc id? Not the coordinates?

what do you mean

item.title: Quick PI question
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

public void saniboch2(int i) {
		
		if (npcs[i].getX() == 3298 && npcs[i].getY() == 3106) {
			c.getPA().movePlayer(Config.START_LOCATION_X, Config.START_LOCATION_Y, 0);
		} else {
            		c.getPA().movePlayer(3299, 3106, 0);
		}
		c.getItems().deleteItem(995, c.getItems().getItemSlot(995), 50);
	
	}

throws an error on the if statement, threw the same error using npcs[i].absX

ignore shit conventions, copy+paste seems to do that

Read full topic
